page.title: 06FARMS AROUND WESTCOTT
page.content: Much of the land around Westcott is owned by the{Broom}family Farms are rented from them and average around 300 acres. Soils are mainly sand and clay. Crops are{ {wheat, barley, oats, beans, rape, hay, {kale}and{grass.} Sheep and beef cattle are kept. Some of the crops are used for{fodder.} Crops are rotated because some crops take out more than they put in to the soil. Some farms have {battery hens. Most farms use a lot of machinery like{tractors and combine harvesters.} Outlets for the produce are the local {markets}in{Guildford and in London. Chadhurst farm specialises in breeding pheasants, another trains dogs. Manor farm had horses and carriages, one for cross country racing, and a grand one for show. Bushy Plat farm breeds goats and sells milk locally.
